data.title: Elisabeth Elliot – Audio Books, Best Sellers, Author Bio
data.meta_description: Learn more about Elisabeth Elliot. Browse Elisabeth Elliot’s best-selling audiobooks and newest titles. Discover more authors you’ll love listening to on Audible.
data.text:
The Mark of a Man

Following Christ's Example of Masculinity

By: Elisabeth Elliot

Narrated by: Nancy Peterson

Length: 4 hrs and 37 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 1

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 1

Story

5 out of 5 stars 1

In a world where men and women are encouraged to reject traditional sex roles, Elisabeth Elliot candidly reminds men why the sexes are not equal and interchangeable. Written as personal advice to her nephew, The Mark of a Man reveals the glory and purpose of true masculinity.

Let Me Be a Woman

By: Elisabeth Elliot

Narrated by: Nan McNamara

Length: 4 hrs and 50 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 314

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 278

Story

5 out of 5 stars 274

Working from Scripture, well-known speaker and author Elisabeth Elliot shares her observations and experiences in a number of essays on what it means to be a Christian woman....

5 out of 5 stars

Sound advice

By Monique on 12-28-19

A Chance to Die

The Life and Legacy of Amy Carmichael

By: Elisabeth Elliot

Narrated by: Elisabeth Martin

Length: 10 hrs and 43 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 8

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 8

Story

5 out of 5 stars 8

A Chance to Die is a vibrant portrayal of Amy Carmichael, an Irish missionary and writer who spent fifty-three years in south India without furlough. There she became known as "Amma," or "mother," as she founded the Dohnavur Fellowship, a refuge for underprivileged children.

5 out of 5 stars

Amy’s steadfastness

By irita minniear on 06-23-24

Suffering Is Never for Nothing

By: Elisabeth Elliott

Narrated by: Pam Ward

Length: 3 hrs and 13 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 662

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 588

Story

5 out of 5 stars 583

Elisabeth Elliot's first husband, Jim, was murdered by the Waoroni people in Ecuador moments after he arrived in hopes of sharing the gospel. Her second husband was lost to cancer. Yet, it was in her deepest suffering that she learned the deepest lessons about God....

5 out of 5 stars

inspiring. real.

By Donna on 07-21-19

Keep a Quiet Heart

By: Elisabeth Elliot

Narrated by: Nancy Peterson

Length: 7 hrs and 39 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4.5 out of 5 stars 6

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 6

Story

5 out of 5 stars 6

Beloved author Elisabeth Elliot shares more than 100 short passages that help you learn to know, trust, and walk with God in a world that does everything in its power to distract us. If you long for a bit of relief and rest, let Elisabeth Elliot be your compassionate guide....

5 out of 5 stars

Godly insights through a woman of wisdom

By P.K. El Cajon on 07-15-24

The circumstances of the death of these men is one of the great missionary adventure stories of modern times....

5 out of 5 stars

Read by the Author?

Elisabeth Elliot plots the treacherous passage through pain, grief, and loss, a journey most of us will make many times in our life....

The Path of Loneliness

Finding Your Way Through the Wilderness to God

By: Elizabeth Elliot

Narrated by: Nancy Peterson

Length: 5 hrs and 2 mins

Unabridged

In The Path of Loneliness, Elliot gives hope to the lonely through tender reflections on God's love for us and his plans to bless us. Here you will find honesty and compassion, not platitudes....

5 out of 5 stars

So Much godly Wisdom

By Richard Henkle on 04-25-24

On Asking God Why

And Other Reflections on Trusting God in a Twisted World

By: Elisabeth Elliot

Narrated by: Aimee Lilly

Length: 5 hrs and 48 mins

Unabridged

Overall

0 out of 5 stars 0

Performance

0 out of 5 stars 0

Story

0 out of 5 stars 0

On Asking God Why offers honest insights into many of today's most prevalent heartaches, including sickness and death, family issues and loneliness, aging and hopelessness.

Love Has a Price Tag

By: Elisabeth Elliot

Narrated by: Nancy Peterson

Length: 3 hrs and 42 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 1

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 1

Story

5 out of 5 stars 1

In a delightfully engaging series of essays, Elisabeth Elliot captures the joys and trials of a life fully given to Christ. A timeless spiritual perspective on the value of being a woman, wife, mother and Christian.
